title: Filipa Patão shared her thoughts on becoming the inaugural head coach of Boston Legacy FC
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Filipa Patão appointed as Boston Legacy FC's first head coach after success at Benfica.
Patão led Benfica to five consecutive league titles and a UEFA Champions League quarterfinal.
Discover Patão's vision for Boston Legacy FC and her thoughts on adapting to the NWSL.

title: Jeremy Swayman feels like a ‘completely different human being’ a year removed from contract dispute
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jeremy Swayman enters the 2025-26 NHL season without contract issues, unlike last year's dispute affecting his performance.
After a poor 2024-25 season, Swayman overhauled his offseason routine, including a successful stint with Team USA at the Worlds.
Discover how Swayman's international success and revamped training approach aim to revive his role as Boston Bruins' top goalie.

title: What Josh McDaniels said about facing the Raiders
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Josh McDaniels will face his former team, the Raiders, in Sunday's home opener as Patriots offensive coordinator.
He spent a brief, challenging stint with the Raiders, recording a 9-16 record before returning to New England.
Discover McDaniels' thoughts on lessons learned and his view on Raiders' new coach Pete Carroll.

title: Elizabeth Banks cast as Karen Read: What readers said about the limited series role
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Elizabeth Banks will portray Karen Read in a Prime Video series on Read's murder case.
The series, also produced by Banks, explores society's fascination with true crime and conspiracy theories.
A Boston.com poll shows 48% support for Banks' casting; find out who readers suggested instead.

title: 2 New England casinos just ranked the best in the U.S. (that aren’t in Las Vegas)
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Mohegan Sun and Foxwoods Casino in Connecticut ranked 2nd and 3rd best U.S. casinos outside Las Vegas.
USA Today readers praised these casinos for their gaming options and guest experiences among over 1,000 U.S. casinos.
Discover which casino topped the list as the No. 1 non-Vegas casino in America, according to USA Today readers.

title: What to know about Seisiún, the two-day Irish music festival coming to Boston
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Seisiún is a two-day Irish music festival at Suffolk Downs, featuring Dropkick Murphys and The Pogues.
The Pogues will make their first U.S. appearance in over 20 years, headlining Day 2 of the festival.
Discover which next-generation Irish artists will join The Pogues on stage for this special reunion.

title: CommonWealth Kitchen staff, members speak out over toxic nonprofit: Globe report
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: CommonWealth Kitchen accused of toxic workplace by staff and members, detailed in a Boston Globe report.
Allegations include lack of promised support, overcharging, and tokenizing minority-owned businesses like Gourmet Kreyol.
Faigel's leadership criticized for fostering a toxic culture; discover former staff's specific experiences and the board's response.

title: 44 proposed Mass. ballot questions, including rent control, move to next step — and 3 don’t make the cut
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Forty-four proposed Massachusetts ballot questions progress, including rent control, while three fail to meet state legal requirements.
Initiatives require 74,574 signatures by December 3, 2025, for legislative consideration, with potential ballot placement in 2026 or 2028.
Rent control, tax changes, and same-day voter registration are among the significant proposals capturing public interest.

title: RFK Jr. tries to defend COVID vaccine stance in raucous Senate hearing
author: The Associated Press
bullets: RFK Jr. faced bipartisan criticism at a Senate hearing over his COVID vaccine policy changes.
He clashed with Sen. Elizabeth Warren and defended firing the CDC director for dishonesty.
RFK Jr.'s comments on vaccine advisory changes left Republicans questioning his stance on Operation Warp Speed.

title: Juvenile with ‘airsoft replica weapon’ determined to have caused UMass Lowell lockdown
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A juvenile with an airsoft gun caused a three-hour lockdown at UMass Lowell campus on Wednesday.
The incident prompted a large response involving local police, FBI, and Massachusetts State Police.
Authorities are determining whether the juvenile will face charges for the lockdown incident.
